content:
Thanks for the tips! I'll definitely try soaking the aerator in hot water and vinegar, and then use a soft-bristled brush to remove any debris. And I'll follow your instructions for cleaning the P-trap with baking soda and hot water.

For the trash can, I think I'll try using baking soda and activated charcoal to absorb the odors. I've heard that activated charcoal is really effective at absorbing smells, so I'm hoping that will make a big difference.

I'm going to tackle these tasks this weekend and see if it makes a difference. If the sink is still slow-draining and smelly after that, I'll know it's time to call a plumber.

Thanks again for your help and advice! You've been really informative and helpful.
